intro: Verbascum aphyllopodum, commonly known as the narrowleaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum aphyllopodum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has historical uses in herbal medicine.
